item.description: This is just a test.

item.title: Some of I Am The Walrus lyrics
item.description:
Mister City policeman sitting Pretty little policemen in a row See how they fly like Lucy in the sky, see how they run I'm crying, I'm crying I'm crying, I'm crying Yellow matter custard Dripping from a dead dog's eye Crabalocker fishwife, pornographic priestess Boy, you've been a naughty girl, you let your knickers down
I am the egg man They are the egg men I am the walrus Goo goo g'joob
one. two. three. four. lalalal

Sitting on a corn flake. Waiting for the van to come. Corporation T-shirt, stupid bloody Tuesday. Man you've been a naughty boy. You let your face grow long. I am the egg man. They are the egg men. I am the walrus. Goo goo g'joob.
[MORE](https://t.co/XfQrIIw6Jq) is a very fine piece of software.
This is a test.

item.title: The Twitter-to-RSS project
item.description:
The project is coming along. Implemented so far... * Tweets can have titles. Make the first character in a tweet a #. The rest of the first line is the title. * Full Markdown support. Anything you can type in a tweet can be Markdown and will be rendered as it's converted to an RSS item. Markdown is ideal for where Twitter is at now. It a plain text environment, and that's what MD is designed for.
* Threads are rolled up into the first message, forming one RSS item. In RSS there is no character limit. And Twitter has a good thread composition tool built in.
* [Emoji short codes](https://t.co/fwkBlnAhAR). This was an easy one so I thought why not. ðŸ˜„
Not sure how I'll package it for release. I want to wait until the major coding is done before deciding that.
*Still diggin!*

item.title: To do on the RSS feed work
item.description: The outline-generating code replaces links with [link] where the word link is hotted up. This conflicts with the Markdown functionality. Right now my thinking is that I'll undo that before running it through the Markdown processor. Here's an example, a link to my blog. [link] And a link using Markdown syntax. [Twitter](https://t.co/J8tUVYddPs) And that's it.

item.title: This is a thread
item.description:
I am going to chain several tweets together in a thread. In the feed, they will be combined into one long post. This is the second tweet in the thread. Thank you very much.
This is also in the second tweet.
And this is in the third.
Hello there.
This is a tweet in a weird place, as a reply to the second tweet.

item.title: This post has Markdown text
item.description: 1. Here's **bold** and *italic* text. 2. A bit of code: `alert ("hello world")` 3. And an all-important [link]([link]) That's it for now! :smile:

item.title: A titled post
item.description: This is a simple titled post, the kind that we can now deal with efficiently. Over the next hours and days I will post more items here that will be part of the feed for this user's twitter account.

item.title: Lyrics of I Am The Walrus
item.description: I am he as you are he as you are me And we are all together See how they run like pigs from a gun See how they fly I'm crying
I am going to tweet again baby.

item.title: Another verse from Waterloo Sunset
item.description: But I don't need no friends As long as I gaze on Waterloo sunset I am in paradise

item.title: Waterloo sunset
item.description: Dirty old river, must you keep rolling Flowing into the night? People so busy, make me feel dizzy Taxi light shines so bright

item.title: Have a cuppa tea
item.description: Granny's always ravin' and rantin', And she's always puffin' and pantin', And she's always screaming and shouting, And she's always brewing up tea.

item.title: A multi-line tweet
item.description: I am going to have this appear as a titled item in my RSS feed. This is a test post I will use. This is another paragraph. And another.
We need another test tweet to prime the pump.
